turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2013 NASCAR Sprint Cup Series.
turn.1: What was the procedure for the 2013 NASCAR Sprint Cup Series standings?
turn.2: For 2013, the top 36 starting positions were set by qualifying speed.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Positions 37 to 42 were set by provisionals (based off owners points).
turn.5: What happened with the final position?
turn.6: Similar to previous seasons, the forty-third position were given to the most recent series champion who didn't qualify on time or the next available team in owner's points.
turn.7: What was the difference between the standings and previous years?
turn.8: Unlike in previous years, the previous years' Owners points were only used for the first three races of a season instead of five.
turn.10: Also, NASCAR instituted a random draw to determine qualifying order instead of inverting the first practice speeds.
turn.12: Director of Competition Robin Pemberton stated the change was made due to teams manipulating their first practice run to get a later qualifying draw.
